[[Windows 98]]{{cite web|title=About ClamWin Free Antivirus|url=http://www.clamwin.com/content/view/71/1/|publisher=ClamWin Pty Ltd|accessdate=26 October 2011}} | programming language = [[C++]] and [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | genre = [[Antivirus]] | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = {{URL|http://www.clamwin.com/}} }} '''ClamWin''' is [[free software|free]], [[open source software|open source]] [[antivirus software]] for [[Microsoft Windows]]. It provides a graphical user interface to the [[ClamAV]] (Clam AntiVirus) engine. == Features == * Scanning scheduler (only effective with user logged in). * Automatic virus database updates on a regular basis. * Standalone virus-scanner. * Context menu integration for [[Windows Explorer]]. * Add-in for Microsoft Outlook. * A portable version that can be used from a [[USB flash drive]]. Firefox extensions exist that allow the users to process downloaded files with ClamWin[https://addons.mozilla.org/fr/firefox/addon/10882/ FireClam]. ===Real-time scanning=== ClamWin does not yet [[real-time protection|automatically scan files]] as they are read and written. This feature is planned for inclusion in the next major version update{{cite web|url=http://www.clamwin.com/content/view/35/27/ |title=Real time on access scanning in ClamWin Free Antivirus |publisher=Clamwin.com |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}} and has been claimed to be in development since at least 10 December 2005.{{cite web|url=http://web.archive.org/web/*/http://www.clamwin.com/content/view/35/27/ |title=Internet Archive Wayback Machine |publisher=Web.archive.org |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}} The non-affiliated project [[Clam Sentinel]] is an add-on that provides a real-time scanning capability to ClamWin. {{cite web|url = http://sourceforge.net/projects/clamsentinel/|title = Clam Sentinel|accessdate = 2010-01-25|last = dynclient|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = January}} == Effectiveness == ClamWin suffers from poor detection rates and its scans are slow and less effective than some other antivirus programs. For example, ClamWin failed to detect almost half of the trojan horses, password stealers, and other malware in AV-Test.org's "zoo" of malware samples.{{cite web|url=http://www.pcworld.idg.com.au/review/security/clamwin/free_antivirus_2009/316878 |title=ClamWin Free Antivirus (2009) - reviews - Security - PC World |publisher=Pcworld.idg.com.au |date=2009-09-01 |accessdate=2010-11-09}}{{cite web|url=http://www.infoworld.com/d/security-central/clamwin-free-antivirus-software-968 |title=Security Central Channel |publisher=InfoWorld |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}} In the ''1 - 21 June 2008'' test performed by Virus.gr, ClamWin version 0.93 detected 54.68% of all threats and ranked 37th out of 49 products tested; the best scored over 99%.{{cite web|url=http://www.virus.gr/portal/en/content/2008-06%2C-1-21-june |title=June 2008 comparison of effectiveness of antivirus programs |publisher=Virus.gr |date= |accessdate=2010-11-09}} In the ''10 August-05 September 2009'' test performed by Virus.gr, ClamWin version 0.95.2 detected 52.48% of all threats and ranked 43 out of 55 products tested;
